reviewText:
An inferior game when compared to NBA 2k12.

Aside from the servers being shut down, so there's absolutely no online functionality:
* Teammates and opponents alike don't box out and rebounds will sometimes magically teleport into a player's hand
* The controls and the game will often fight you when you're trying to move, particularly when you're trying to defend a quick opponent, so you end up going the opposite direction than you indicate with your controller first before going in the direction you want to.
* Significant foul bias in favor of the AI to a point where a player-controlled player may get hit 3 or 4 times and still not get a foul call, while an AI-controlled player gets a foul called for being breathed on.
* During MyCareer, bigs on your team who rebound the ball will hold it to prevent a fast break.
* Collision detection is bad; sometimes, for no reason, you getting sucked into a collision with a player even though you're not trying to go towards them.

Basically, this is a roster update, and one that costs 30USD. Save your money, go play NBA 2k12 instead.

reviewText:
This game is solid for what it is. It is well produced and well made, and it can lead to some very fun moments where you feel like a badass on the court. But as you keep playing, you'll eventually start to get frustrated and even angry at times. This is because of it's design even though it was well executed, like performing every step perfectly in a bad plan. I have 100 hours in this game so you can take this however you want.

So what's bad about the design? Everything feels sluggish. In the attempt to simulate real life, they gave every action you can make an unavoidable movement animation. A lot of times you just want your character to jump and block a shot, but instead he takes a second to recover from taking one step to the right and THEN jump after which the ball has already fell through your basket. This happens for everything from stealing to juking. The crucial split second window you need to achieve is sometimes unattainable just because your character takes way too long to react to your button presses.

Every action is also probability based. I understand if the shot risky, then it should give you a probability chance of getting the points or not, but it also extends to simple dribbling without pressure. Losing a ton of grade rating (the game's mechanism for telling you how well you are doing) because of a series bad random number generations is just so rage inducing, especially when it's something you expect to succeed.

I guess these are my two biggest gripes about the game but there are a lot more I won't bother to go into detail for:
- team grading punishes you hard for any mistake
- punishes for bad call for passes when you just want to press A to skip the cutscene (A is call for a pass)
- your character is sometimes ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ (when you attempt to steal he swipes in the OPPOSITE direction of the ball)
- some movement animations take a couple seconds which is way too long
- your character sometimes trips over for NO reason (total probability based ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t)
- simulated games have 20min quarter while played games have 5min quarters. This inconsistency is bad because when it comes to awards which is determined by stats, you have players on other teams average 28 points, when it's pretty much impossible to score anywhere near that many points in your 5min quarter games
- the indicator that tells you who to guard changes a lot, and the team grading system will still punish you even when the indicator randomly changes last second to a player who just scored, saying Allowed man to score".

There are plenty more where that came from but I don't want to make it too long. I'll say again that the game IS well-produced

reviewText:
I have played this game quite a while and have tried numerous settings and on my career mode with several player positions. I maxed the stats out on my first character, a point guard.

Pros
- character development can be engaging
- some people complain about the button controls but I find the flexibility to be interesting and compelling

Cons
- I know 2k tries to make the game realistic and I am sure they have experts but they are missing some fundamental dynamics that really hurt the game. For goodness sakes they dont even know the difference between a screen and a pick.
- While I dont mind the button controls, the actual player movement in the game is a disaster and I cant find a way to fix it. You have mangetic players that stick to one another. What I mean by that is even if you are trying to run in a certain direction the game forces you to face in directions you dont want to face and these crappy animations end up controlling more movement that you do with the controller. Response time is awful. There is a huge delay between when you press a button and when the action occurs. There have been times I tried to lunge sideways to block a pass and the ball is already at half court before my player moves, who was under the basket.
- player AI is aweful. Why on earth would a guard on defense stand at the corner of the key when the offensive player is at the three point line? The number of open 3's in the game is ridiculous and when the guard stands at the corner of the key he obstructs trying to guard the post player.
- 3 second defensive rule is rubbish in the NBA and it is rubbish in this game. If the offensive player is standing at the edge of the paint then you should still be able to stand between him and the basket without getting a penalty called on defense.
- The game is too stats driven. All that matters is what your stat is in a particular area. Success should have more focus on position both for defense and offense. A 7 foot offensive player should not miss a dunk with a 6 foot point guard on him. He misses because the guard has a defense rating of 95 - in that situation size is more important.
- Coaching management is aweful. Why on earth does my 6 foot point guard enter the game at center, power forward or even small forward? Why does my center enter the game at small forward? It makes no sense and there is no coach in the NBA that would be so stupid.

In addition to those issues, the game needs more dynamic interaction. Why cant I yell at that stupid scoring guard during the game who keeps jacking up 3's while guarded and without defenders back to try and rebound? Why cant I yell at that point guard who dances around the half court line and then mysteriously tries to pass across court to a guarded player on the base line? Why cant I hell at the point guard who goes fastbreak up the court when all the defenders are back and tries to drive into 3 defenders?

These comments are based on my career mode and not online play. Online play is a waste of time when people find ways to mod characters - like COD - I will never understand why people still put out money for that crap.

From the reviews I read, neither of the later NBA2k games are any better. They are producing the exact same product with a few minor features with updated rosters and player stats. Dont be a robot fanboy and pay attention to what you pay for.
